intro: Heteropappus leptocladus, commonly known as the slender-bracted fleabane, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with hairy, gray-green leaves. Its yellow flowers appear in clusters and bloom in the summer months. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability.
